items.title: A Pier Deal Is Full of Developer Perks, but Is It Good for the City?
items.abstract: Generous incentives will secure a project that keeps New Yorkâ€™s motion picture industry competitive, officials say. Critics call the price too steep.

items.title: N.Y.C. Officials Tangle With State Over Sleep Ban at Homeless Centers
items.abstract: The city has continued to enforce the policy to prevent young people from sleeping at the centers. Advocates for homeless youth have called the policy cruel.

items.title: After a Ban on Sleeping at Homeless Youth Centers, a Center Resists
items.abstract: The number of runaway and homeless young people using drop-in programs in New York City has surged. Now, the city says they must stay awake, even overnight.

items.title: Private Development Feared in City-Owned Complex
items.abstract: A plan by the New York City Housing Authority to raze the busy community center in the Washington Houses for private residential development has aroused concern.

items.title: Scientists Propose a New Architecture for Sustainable Development
items.abstract: Analysts of global environmental trends seek to topple the three pillars of sustainable development.
